text: cornbread is a classic quick bread and
this one really is quick and so
delicious start with one and a half cups
of cornmeal and to that add one and a
quarter cups all-purpose flour for
leavening x' we have two teaspoons of
baking powder half a teaspoon of baking
soda goes in two teaspoons of salt
that's coarse salt and for sweetness 1/2
a cup of granulated sugar and all you
have to do is whisk this together until
it's combined no need to sift make sure
that's nice and aerated and fully
incorporated and for the wet ingredients
one in 3/4 cup buttermilk if you don't
have buttermilk in the house you can
also use plain milk and just stir in
about a tablespoon of white vinegar or
lemon juice and that will create texture
of buttermilk so to that 6 tablespoons
of butter that's three quarters of a
stick and remember it should always be
insulted and two large eggs and this
also can just be whisked together to
combine the wet ingredients just go
right into the dry ingredients so make
sure those dry ingredients are in a
great big bowl right into the center
like that and gently fold these
ingredients together just until your
batter comes together and then set it
aside while you grate the cheese for the
cheese I'm using 8 ounces of Monterey
Jack you could also use that Monterey
Jack with jalapeno if you like it's
spicy
or you could use a good cheddar cheese
it's a fine melting cheese as well it's
just great at all just like that okay so
that goes into our bowl with our
cornbread base and to that also a small
can of chopped green chilies these are
available in many brands and you can buy
them spicy or mild and those get folded
in these little chilies add a lot of
flavor to the cornbread even if you
think you're not a fan of chilies you'll
be a fan of chilies in this cornbread I
promise you it just imparts that
wonderful pepper flavor and for the
topping these adorable little sweet mini
bell peppers you can find these nowadays
in most grocery stores they impart sweet
pepper flavor into the cornbread and
they also look beautiful on the top I
have 5 ounces here transfer the
cornbread batter into a buttered 9 by
13 baking pan you can just dump that
right in and level the top to make it
flat for adding your peppers I want to
make sure I get every last bit of that
delicious batter into the pan okay and
just use your spatula to gently press
the batter flat you just want it evenly
distributed in the pan and right on the
top go to the little pepper rounds and I
like to just randomly scatter them over
the top I think that makes for a
prettier presentation and this is ready
for a preheated 400 degree oven for
about 20 to 25 minutes until it's puffed
and golden brown along the edges our
cornbread is out of the oven and looking
fabulous let it cool in the pan for
about five minutes and then flip it out
onto a wire rack to cool further about
another 15 minutes at least I like to
serve it warm and rather than squares I
like to cut little wedges first cut it
lengthwise straight down and then on
each side you can cut little wedges this
cornbread is so good on its own and the
presentation is so nice can also butter
little mini muffin tins and transfer the
batter I've made some here to show you
look at that isn't that great little
bite-size cornbread muffins perfect for
a cocktail party or as an appetizer
before dinner or to pack in your kid's
lunch make this recipe once and I
promise you it's gonna become your go-to
cornbread so easy
you
